title: Pilote mobile home logotype font
content:
Hello, I’m trying to find out if this logo uses any existing font? It is a french manufacturer of mobile homes. Obviously the ’o’ character couldn’t be part of the font; that is a sub-logo of theirs. But the rest, is it anything you recognize? I’ve tried the WTF checker and and some questions-based guides, but no luck. The image is from their website, [http://www.pilote.fr](http://web.archive.org/web/20080928123313/http:/www.pilote.fr/ "http://www.pilote.fr") . They have been around for quite some time, so I doubt it is a recent font.

Thank you in advance for any hints.  
Martin Persson, Sweden

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [logo\_acc\_en.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20080928123313/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_acc_en.gif) | 4.54 KB |

 [‹ PLS HELP](http://web.archive.org/web/20080928123313/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49805 "Go to previous forum topic") [Embroidery text- can get same or similar font name, ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080928123313/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49804 "Go to next forum topic")
author: xarragon

comments.content:
I extracted the letters and to me it looks custom heres a jpg. I ran it through wtf but didn’t find anything close.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080928123313im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Pilote_6195.jpg)

[Fargon Medium Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080928123313/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/garagefonts/fargon_medium_italic/) is what the use for all those other little logos!
Excellent! Thanks for all your help. I’ll deal with the custom logo myself, but I really wanted the font for some other text I’ll be creating. And now I know what I need thanks to you, robbiefa.
